title: Ticket #475: Option to run w/ one gridmanager per remote site.
description:
Currently, the schedd will start a new gridmanager instance per UID of the submitter.

We think it would be advantageous to provide greater isolation based upon remote site destination, so if Condor-G is submitting to a slow site over a slow WAN for example, it would minimize impact upon job throughput to fast/nearby sites. In theory it should not matter since the GRAM interface in Globus is supposedly non-blocking, but in practice we'd sleep better at night. ;-)

Thus, we'd like an option for the schedd to start a new gridmanager instance based upon a tuple of both submitter UID and remote destination.
remarks:
2009-May-15 07:26:23 by tannenba:
So a great idea regarding this (credit to Jaime): have a classad expression in the config file return a string that will be used as a hash value. All jobs that hash to the same value via this expression will go to the same gridmanager. Neat, eh? I plan to implement it this way.
